metadata.synopsis: These can play once, and then be cancelled, or persist until more specific cancel conditions are met. Or alternatively, if another TG node becomes valid, it will cancel any previous ones.They may or may not lead back to the InParty dialog.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Plays if the companion has something notable to say after various story moments.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: You were wise to spare Karlach. She's got the brawn of a warrior and the wiles of a survivor.

283.speaker: Lae'zel
283.text: Best of all, she speaks her mind, plainly and fully. Show her due respect.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But I think I trust Gale even less.

130.speaker: Lae'zel
130.text: He must give it to her when the time comes, or his lust for power might well consume him.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Orin thinks Gale's abduction is an ultimatum to kill Gortash.

189.speaker: Lae'zel
189.text: Foolish woman - as if I needed more reason than I already had.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: Strike without mercy. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!
8.context:
NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith

YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: We're good and done with the Iron Throne - and I've no wish to return.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: You have become the Slayer - or has a Slayer merely found a host too weak to evict it?

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: I shouldn't need to say it, but - be careful who you take as an ally. Especially when that ally's taken residence inside you.

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: Orin thinks Halsin's abduction is an ultimatum to kill Gortash.

238.speaker: Lae'zel
238.text: Foolish woman - as if I needed more reason than I already had.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Gale should watch what he eats. He's positively oozing dark magic.

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: Another dream, another order from that dubious visitor.

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: It announced that we will find the answers that we seek in the Absolute cultists' lair - and offered another generous 'gift'.

184.speaker: Lae'zel
184.text: A persuasive creature. It tempts us with power, expresses its admiration, its adoration.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: Avert your eyes, whenever it appears. And do not avail yourself of this new power, no matter how alluring.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: You've no idea what damage it could do to us, how far into illithid madness it could drag us.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: We can use this skill to manipulate these cultists. We'd be fools to refuse it.

269.speaker: Lae'zel
269.text: Battles are won with swords, not mind-games born of brain-worms. The ones we fight with these cultists will be no different.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: And there will come a battle, of that I'm most certain. The one truth that fell out of the dream figure's cankered lips.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I think the dream figure was right: follow these cultists, and we find the source of our tadpoles.

192.speaker: Lae'zel
192.text: Yes - the one truth that fell out of its cankered lips.

225.speaker: Lae'zel
225.text: There will come a battle. But it will be won with swords, not mind-games born of brain-worms.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I distrust the visitor, too. I'll avoid using this power.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Well chosen. Battles are won with swords, not mind-games born of brain-worms.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: We should tell Dame Aylin of Lorroakan's intentions.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: I look forward to helping her pound this whelp's skull to grit.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: Your lust for power is... concerning, Gale.

172.speaker: Lae'zel
172.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But I think I trust you even less.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Give it to her when the time comes. You will find no redemption or honour in godhood - only the burden of a million empty souls looking for a saviour you can never be.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Something is... different about Shadowheart. New facial creases, perhaps? A fresh battlescar I hadn't noticed?

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: Strike down the Emperor and break Orpheus free with the hammer.

287.speaker: Lae'zel
287.text: He will help us defeat the Netherbrain, and lead the githyanki people to a glorious future.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: A ghaik colony - or something close to it. You'll find no place more repellent in all the planes.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: You will refuse the ghaik and break Orpheus free from his prison - and we will crush his skull, Vlaakith be praised.
34.context: NodeContext: VAHR-ith-inn (a kind of psionic builder)

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: Chk - the devil Mizora's made herself quite at home, hasn't she?

263.speaker: Lae'zel
263.text: Do make her feel as unwelcome as you can.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: G'lyck. I had a dream. As we all did, I suspect.

202.speaker: Lae'zel
202.text: Someone came to me and promised to protect me while claiming that the parasite could empower me.

174.speaker: Lae'zel
174.text: The parasite has taken root, it would seem. Every word, every promise - it is ghaik deception.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: If the parasite can empower us, I say we should let it. We could use the edge in combat.

243.speaker: Lae'zel
243.text: You're delusional. I'd sooner trust a night hag than a strange figure bearing dream-gifts.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: You're right. We should ignore this dream figure at all costs.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: A wise choice. These parasites are a threat to be destroyed, not an opportunity to be exploited.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: This is the city proper, is it? I didn't expect it to be so outrageously... ordinary.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Astarion chose right. And any well-trained githyanki would have chosen the same.

253.speaker: Lae'zel
253.text: We seek might not for individual power, but for the good of the collective.

282.speaker: Lae'zel
282.text: Every enemy I slay strengthens not only myself, but the Githyanki Empire.

200.speaker: Lae'zel
200.text: To seek power for personal glory alone is a farce. Astarion was wise to see it.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: You know what you must do.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: With that amulet, the Lord of Murder has claimed you. Let us see what you make of his 'gift'.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Chk - the devil Mizora's made herself quite at home, hasn't she?

205.speaker: Lae'zel
205.text: Do make her feel as unwelcome as you can.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: I will not be party to Orpheus' murder. I will not let you assimilate the Prince of the Comet!

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: Shadowheart's chosen her loyalties. Good. It is always best to know where one's allies - and enemies - stand.
60.context: NodeContext: Deep disappointment, almost to the point of heartbreak, that SH went the evil route.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Karlach's fate may be written, but her story isn't ended.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: The histories of the greatest githyanki warriors are recorded in slate. They are unerasable.

151.speaker: Lae'zel
151.text: She must make every battle her bloodiest yet. She must make herself unerasable, too.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: The air is thick with blood. I can't see it - but I can smell it.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: Strike down the Emperor and break Orpheus free with the hammer.

144.speaker: Lae'zel
144.text: He will help us defeat the Netherbrain, and lead the githyanki people to a glorious future.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: You know what you must do.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: It is no small thing, to slay one's life-bringers. Shadowheart did what was right, not what was easy.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Shar's spirit lingers here. The air's thick with lies and trickery.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But I think I trust you even less.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: Give it to her when the time comes, or your lust for power might well consume you.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: Assimilate the prince and become illithid. This is how we will end the prince, and this is how we will defeat the Netherbrain.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Karlach's got the brawn of a warrior and the wiles of a survivor.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Best of all, she speaks her mind, plainly and fully. Show her due respect.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: The seat of the Absolute - and the source of our altered tadpoles.

133.speaker: Lae'zel
133.text: Stay your blade when you're able. Interrogate who you can. Answers first, bloodshed later.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Ugh. Let's talk once we're out of his flesh-pit.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: Astarion succumbed to his power-lust. A githyanki would have known better.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: We seek might not for individual power, but for the good of the collective.

123.speaker: Lae'zel
123.text: Every enemy I slay strengthens not only myself, but the Githyanki Empire.

233.speaker: Lae'zel
233.text: To seek power for personal glory alone is a farce. A shame he can't see it.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: Such an elaborate trial - the sort Vlaakith subjects Tu'narath's elders to, should they grow too decadent.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: Full-fledged vampires are not so easily slain. Astarion's master will be no exception.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Fortunate for him, slaying monstrous fanatics is a pastime of ours.

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: Bhaalspawn? I'm not surprised. You've become death incarnate. Mighty, yes. And altogether unpredictable and intractable.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: One day, perhaps soon, Bhaal will demand your fealty. You'll either muster the strength to defy him - or you will succumb.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Shadowheart's search is concluded. The Nightsinger may inflict pain upon her, but never her will.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: If death is soon to take Karlach, she should make every moment as rich as the last.

275.speaker: Lae'zel
275.text: Fight viciously, roar loudly, step boldly. She must make herself known.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: The hammer is ours, the devil is snuffed out. Our power is undeniable!

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: Wyll shall force all devilkind to tremble before him. The Hells have much to fear.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Good to have the wizard back with us. Thanks to him, my Common vocabulary has grown considerably.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: Fated to madness, or so Bhaal claims. Believe it, and it will surely come to pass. Which is why you must challenge it.

135.speaker: Lae'zel
135.text: Madness could still take you. But you'd go honourably, fighting 'til the very last.

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: 'Githyanki.' The word means, quite literally, 'Gith's children'.

115.speaker: Lae'zel
115.text: But I have never known 'family' the way Jaheira knows it. My so-called 'cousins' are simply spawn hatched from the same clutch.

272.speaker: Lae'zel
272.text: I will never know who laid the egg I hatched from, and until I met Jaheira's family, I never thought to wonder...

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: Well - enough brooding. What did you need?

100.speaker: Lae'zel
100.text: Do not dwell on Shadowheart's fate. We are equally mighty without her.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: Shallow breaths, istik. The smoke will kill you before the fire does.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: Karlach's fate may be written, but her story isn't ended.

226.speaker: Lae'zel
226.text: The histories of the greatest githyanki warriors are recorded in slate. They are unerasable.

217.speaker: Lae'zel
217.text: She must make every battle her bloodiest yet. She must make herself unerasable, too.

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: Astarion proved himself no less maniacal than his master. His death was a favour - to him, to us, and to the city.

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.text: Good riddance to Ketheric Thorm. We will see that his allies suffer the same fate.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: Astarion succumbed to his power-lust. A githyanki would have known better.

229.speaker: Lae'zel
229.text: We seek might not for individual power, but for the good of the collective.

286.speaker: Lae'zel
286.text: Every enemy I slay strengthens not only myself, but the Githyanki Empire.

281.speaker: Lae'zel
281.text: To seek power for personal glory alone is a farce. A shame he can't see it.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: Viconia sought that which she could never have controlled. Her failure was written from the start.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: Shadowheart suffers. You might be surprised, but - it pains me to see.

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Now - what would you ask of me?

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: I had all but lost faith in the so-called Sharran. It takes a stout will to prove me wrong.

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: A perfect circle. Wyll began as the Coast's champion; it's right he should remain as such.

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: The Hells have taken their prize - and the frontiers have lost their Blade.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: The Blade of Frontiers in the guise of a devil. I'd remark on the irony, but I'd hate to waste the breath.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Still - it took guts to defy that petty patron of yours. The Blade's sting is real.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: Still - it took guts to defy that petty patron of his. The Blade's sting is real.

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: Orin - tsk'va! Burn away the shadows she hides in, tear off her mask, and you'd reveal her for what she is:

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: I will not be party to Orpheus' murder. I will not let you assimilate the Prince of the Comet!

124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: Mystra must be pleased with Gale - I can sense the Weave's threads winding about him.

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: The drow is unpredictable, uncompromising. I respect her almost as much as I distrust her.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: You are worried about this killing urge. I can see it.

244.speaker: Lae'zel
244.text: I will try to help you resist. But spill a single drop of my blood, and yours will flow in a gusher.

132.speaker: Lae'zel
132.text: Isn't it glorious? Karlach's fury is a wonder to behold.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: The wizard was a useful find. Let's hope he's as powerful as he is verbose.

139.speaker: Lae'zel
139.text: Astarion chose right. And any well-trained githyanki would have chosen the same.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: We seek might not for individual power, but for the good of the collective.

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: Every enemy I slay strengthens not only myself, but the Githyanki Empire.

276.speaker: Lae'zel
276.text: To seek power for personal glory alone is a farce. Astarion was wise to see it.

140.speaker: Lae'zel
140.text: Assimilate the prince and become illithid. This is how we will end the prince, and this is how we will defeat the Netherbrain.

142.speaker: Lae'zel
142.text: It was unsightly, watching Shadowheart slay the daughter of Selûne. I didn't think she would sink so low.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Speak, and let's be done with it.

143.speaker: Lae'zel
143.text: On Crèche K'liir, giant space hamsters are a staple food. Their hocks are quite scrumptious - if a bit fatty.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Wait a moment. Giant space hamsters are real?

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: Very. But I've never heard of a miniature version, let alone a conversant one. Which means Boo is either a rare specimen...

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Don't tell Minsc. It would devastate him.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: And addle his brain even further? I wouldn't dream of it.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: Besides, I've never heard of a miniature version, let alone a conversant one. Which means Boo is either a rare specimen...

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: ...or an ordinary hamster. Either way, I'm not about to go nibbling on him.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: You eat hamsters? You better leave Boo alone.

118.speaker: Lae'zel
118.text: I've never heard of a miniature version, let alone a conversant one. Which means Boo is either a rare specimen...

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I wouldn't mind having a taste, to be honest.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: It's a long way to K'liir. As for Boo, I've never heard of a miniature giant space hamster, let alone a conversant one. Which means Boo is either a rare specimen...

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: ...or an ordinary hamster. Not fit for eating, either way.

145.speaker: Lae'zel
145.text: So you've an explosive buried in you? My allies do so love to keep simmering secrets.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Hence your bearded visitor. Even the githyanki have heard tell of Elminster, the Sage of Shadowdale, you know. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: That doesn't mean his every word carries wisdom, however.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Near as I can tell, your goddess demands faith - but holds no faith in you.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: Why else would she demand you sacrifice yourself and perhaps so many others?

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: Does she not think you can destroy the Absolute with your own immense talents? Does she not know the mighty company that you keep?

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Demanding Vlaakith may be, but she acts for the good of the githyanki people. Mystra is concerned only for herself.

147.speaker: Lae'zel
147.text: Bah - perhaps you'd find forgiveness in a fiery death. But I can't help but wonder why you'd want it at all.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Near as I can tell, Mystra demands Gale's faith - but holds no faith in him.

138.speaker: Lae'zel
138.text: Why else would she demand Gale sacrifice himself and perhaps so many others?

171.speaker: Lae'zel
171.text: Does she not think he can destroy the Absolute with his own immense talents? Does she not know the mighty company that he keeps?

268.speaker: Lae'zel
268.text: Demanding Vlaakith may be, but she acts for the good of the githyanki people. Mystra is concerned only for herself.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: Bah - perhaps he'd find forgiveness in a fiery death. But I can't help but wonder why he'd want it at all.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: Cazador's minions have picked up our trail. For Astarion's sake, I hope this was the last of them.

148.speaker: Lae'zel
148.text: Can you feel it - that ache in your skull, that silent scream? The brain wants us for its puppets.

149.speaker: Lae'zel
149.text: The light here warms my skin, cleanses my lungs. A welcome change from the surrounding shadow.

150.speaker: Lae'zel
150.text: Illusions abound in this place. Trust neither your eyes nor your ears.

152.speaker: Lae'zel
152.text: Orin thinks this abduction is some sort of... ultimatum to kill Gortash.

251.speaker: Lae'zel
251.text: Foolish woman - as if I needed more reason than I already had.

154.speaker: Lae'zel
154.text: Thorm's on the run. Quickly - we must follow!

156.speaker: Lae'zel
156.text: I feel... odd. My memories feel more like dreams, or stories I've half-overheard.

157.speaker: Lae'zel
157.text: With the Nightsong at our side, we will crush Ketheric quickly.

180.speaker: Lae'zel
180.text: I'm impressed, Shadowheart. You chose rightly and courageously.

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: I'm impressed. Shadowheart chose rightly and courageously.

158.speaker: Lae'zel
158.text: I sought to reach a githyanki crèche and be rid of these tadpoles. Now we stalk forgotten lands haunted by darkness.

160.speaker: Lae'zel
160.text: The House is excessive, overwrought, and ever-so-seedy - a perfect reflection of its owner.

161.speaker: Lae'zel
161.text: Mark my word: The half-elf's an abyss of lies and secrets. 'Shadowheart' indeed.

162.speaker: Lae'zel
162.text: Gortash stinks no more as a corpse than he did as Bane's chosen. We've done well.

164.speaker: Lae'zel
164.text: It seems Jaheira's devotion to Minsc was stronger than her devotion to defeating the brain - and saving her city.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: She still has every chance to prove me wrong.

166.speaker: Lae'zel
166.text: This place is... enlightening. My own crèche, K'liir, is remote and sunless, cloaked in the silence of wildspace.

216.speaker: Lae'zel
216.text: My sa'varsh would find this one altogether too genial.

167.speaker: Lae'zel
167.text: Should I ever take to the Astral Plane, I'll have no need of scrolls to secure my immortality.

230.speaker: Lae'zel
230.text: Still, it is becoming of a mortal to accept their fate, as Jaheira does. Not everyone is meant to live longer than the stars.

168.speaker: Lae'zel
168.text: Raphael may be shka'keth, but it sounds like he wants us to slay a mighty devil. I say we indulge him.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: No warrior of worth would resist such tantalising prey.

169.speaker: Lae'zel
169.text: The Dread Lord craves victims. I say, let him starve.

170.speaker: Lae'zel
170.text: Orin be damned - her bloody fingerprints are all over this city.

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: Chk - goblins. Not a shred of dignity to be found among them.

175.speaker: Lae'zel
175.text: So Gale carries an explosive inside him? My allies do so love to keep simmering secrets.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Hence his bearded visitor. Even the githyanki have heard tell of Elminster, the Sage of Shadowdale. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

176.speaker: Lae'zel
176.text: 'Duke Wyll Ravengard.' A moniker Wyll shall justly earn.

177.speaker: Lae'zel
177.text: Elminster? Even the githyanki have heard tell of the Sage of Shadowdale. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

178.speaker: Lae'zel
178.text: The githyanki people have a word for men like the Blade of Frontiers: She'lak.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: Roughly translated: 'idealist do-gooder'. Or better yet, 'benevolent burden'.

277.speaker: Lae'zel
277.text: His confidence is an asset. His pursuit of valour? Not so much.

182.speaker: Lae'zel
182.text: My my, aren't we feeling voracious?

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: Suck up all the magic you need, Gale, provided you don't go snacking on a githyanki silver sword. But I'd care to know the reason for it.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Tell Lae'zel about the orb in your chest, and how it came to be there.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Some objects enhance my magical prowess.

163.speaker: Lae'zel
163.text: The truth according to Gale: the abridged edition. Now, care to tell me the details, or will you be leaving me to guess?

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Tell Lae'zel the story of your orb. Leave nothing out.

203.speaker: Lae'zel
203.text: A quest for power and a goddess' retribution - a classic tale of hubris. A folly even the githyanki are known to suffer from.

165.speaker: Lae'zel
165.text: Not that I could relate, of course.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: My choices seem simple enough. One: Slay you and be done with it. Two: Go my own way. Three: Keep you well-fed with powerful magic.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: The first two are tempting, I must say - but a good wizard's spells are as valuable to me as my blade is to them.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: So choice three it is: we will fatten you with the artefacts you require. And when I need your aid, I'll make certain you return the favour.

274.speaker: Lae'zel
274.text: A fair trade by any estimation.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: So be it. But the truth will out, Gale. Some secrets can't go untold forever.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I'd sooner not talk about it.

186.speaker: Lae'zel
186.text: The Shadowfell - the depravity of Shar's spirit laid bare. Kaincha...
186.context: NodeContext: CANE-cha. Don't say as exclamation but a little more like a sigh.

187.speaker: Lae'zel
187.text: The crossroads of magic and fabrication. Even the githyanki mlar could learning something from this place.

190.speaker: Lae'zel
190.text: Sarevok'cha tsk'in'va. Or as they say in the local parlance: Sarevok can eat shit.

193.speaker: Lae'zel
193.text: An underwater prison - a shrewd idea. Gortash is nothing if not a meticulous schemer.

194.speaker: Lae'zel
194.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But you are wise to give it to her.

195.speaker: Lae'zel
195.text: Every githyanki has held a sword by age six, and claims their first kill by age ten.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: Yet these tieflings claim barely a single warrior among them. It's a wonder they've survived even this long.

196.speaker: Lae'zel
196.text: We made short work of those who would hunt Astarion.

280.speaker: Lae'zel
280.text: But if his new status proves a liability, I won't hesitate to strike him down.

199.speaker: Lae'zel
199.text: Orin thinks Minthara's abduction is an ultimatum to kill Gortash.

257.speaker: Lae'zel
257.text: Foolish woman - as if I needed more reason than I already had.

201.speaker: Lae'zel
201.text: Shadowheart was no true child of Shar - merely a captive. She must have her vengeance.

204.speaker: Lae'zel
204.text: Mizora positively drips with passive-aggressive condescension.

231.speaker: Lae'zel
231.text: I much prefer straightforward condescension - it leaves no chance of being misunderstood.

206.speaker: Lae'zel
206.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But I think I trust Gale even less.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: He should give it to her and be done with it, or his lust for power might well consume him.

207.speaker: Lae'zel
207.text: Full-fledged vampires are not so easily slain. Astarion's master will be no exception.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: Fortunate for him, slaying monstrous fanatics is a pastime of ours.

209.speaker: Lae'zel
209.text: A perfect sanctum for rats - the literal and metaphorical sort.

210.speaker: Lae'zel
210.text: Astarion was a useful weapon in our arsenal. His loss will require some adaptations.

211.speaker: Lae'zel
211.text: The drider's light protects us. Don't wander off, unless you want to be devoured by shadow.

212.speaker: Lae'zel
212.text: Karlach's got the brawn of a warrior and the wiles of a survivor.

227.speaker: Lae'zel
227.text: Best of all, she speaks her mind, plainly and fully. Show her due respect.

213.speaker: Lae'zel
213.text: You have vanquished the Slayer, as I knew you would. You are strong, you are mighty. You are you.

215.speaker: Lae'zel
215.text: You know what you must do.

218.speaker: Lae'zel
218.text: Desperation is the obverse of wisdom. Zevlor was always destined to fail his people - and to fail us.

221.speaker: Lae'zel
221.text: I can't see how this dark lantern of Gale's will help us. Time will tell if that is my failure, or his.

222.speaker: Lae'zel
222.text: Elminster? Even the githyanki have heard tell of the Sage of Shadowdale. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

223.speaker: Lae'zel
223.text: Minsc is the Stone Lord? Jaheira's friend doesn't sound so friendly after all.

224.speaker: Lae'zel
224.text: Halsin's proved himself a fine ally already. He'll be useful in battle, If those tree-trunk arms are an indication.

228.speaker: Lae'zel
228.text: Voracious, aren't we? Well, suck up all the magic you need, as long as you don't snack on a githyanki silver sword.

232.speaker: Lae'zel
232.text: So that was Elminster? Even the githyanki have heard tell of him, you know. Some of his works have been translated to tir'su.

235.speaker: Lae'zel
235.text: Cities beneath cities, layers below layers. Faerûn is a richer land than I'd imagined.

237.speaker: Lae'zel
237.text: Lord Bhaal's Chosen. You must think yourself mighty for it.

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: Yet you were already mighty. And you would have been mightier still if you'd defied him and your 'urges'.

239.speaker: Lae'zel
239.text: You will refuse the ghaik and break Orpheus free from his prison - and we will crush his skull, Vlaakith be praised.
239.context: NodeContext: VAHR-ith-inn (a kind of psionic builder)

241.speaker: Lae'zel
241.text: An underwater prison - a shrewd idea. Gortash was nothing if not a meticulous schemer.

245.speaker: Lae'zel
245.text: The brain's defeat is certain. The mlar scholars will carve our deeds here in slate.

246.speaker: Lae'zel
246.text: This wizard has no more wit than a half-trained hatchling. To believe his quarry dead, because his enemies say it is so?

234.speaker: Lae'zel
234.text: Let Dame Aylin take his head. He clearly has no use for it.

247.speaker: Lae'zel
247.text: Astarion's pale cheeks are a bit pinker than before. He looks positively - alive.

249.speaker: Lae'zel
249.text: Should I ever take to the Astral Plane, I'll have no need of scrolls to secure my immortality.

220.speaker: Lae'zel
220.text: But whatever our fates, we should accept them. Not everyone is meant to live longer than the stars.

250.speaker: Lae'zel
250.text: The Mother of All Magic, they say. Let us hope Mystra brings Gale good fortunes.

252.speaker: Lae'zel
252.text: Gale's lust for power is... concerning.

219.speaker: Lae'zel
219.text: I do not trust Mystra to do right with the crown. But I am quite sure I trust him even less.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: He must give it to her when the time comes. He will find no redemption or honour in godhood - only the burden of a million empty souls looking for a saviour he can never be.

254.speaker: Lae'zel
254.text: A devil will come for her due. Mizora is no different.

248.speaker: Lae'zel
248.text: Whatever it is she comes to offer, whatever choice Wyll makes, someone will suffer. Count on it.

255.speaker: Lae'zel
255.text: Our camp houses an impostor, then. Say nothing, trust no one. Not even me.

259.speaker: Lae'zel
259.text: Kaincha! No good will come of devouring a ghaik worm, no matter what you might think.

260.speaker: Lae'zel
260.text: Full-fledged vampires are not so easily slain. Astarion's master will be no exception.

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: Fortunate for him, slaying monstrous fanatics is a pastime of ours.

261.speaker: Lae'zel
261.text: Good thing for Wyll that Karlach called a truce. A tiefling that mighty would shred him to pieces and burn the remains.

264.speaker: Lae'zel
264.text: I hope we're not finished with our current labours before Minthara drops her egg. War is the perfect nursery for a child.

265.speaker: Lae'zel
265.text: Owing to your dubious compulsions, we've lost crucial allies.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: You may be powerful. But you are not insightful.

266.speaker: Lae'zel
266.text: I was no friend to Alfira - but there was no sense in killing her. I'll be watching everyone in this camp like a hawk.

267.speaker: Lae'zel
267.text: Orin's dead. Which means we have taken one more step closer to slaughtering the fetid elder brain.

270.speaker: Lae'zel
270.text: The curse is broken and the shadows are lifting. In time, these lands will heal.

271.speaker: Lae'zel
271.text: The imperious elf's got the red eyes and pale skin of a wight.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: And I'm not convinced he's any more trustworthy.

273.speaker: Lae'zel
273.text: So Gale carries an explosive inside him? My allies do so love to keep simmering secrets.

278.speaker: Lae'zel
278.text: Gale is positively voracious. Well - let him suck up all the magic he needs, as long as he doesn't snack on a githyanki silver sword.

279.speaker: Lae'zel
279.text: Shadowheart was - well, she and I - *sigh*.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: This was a cruel fate. No matter our differences, she deserved better from us.

284.speaker: Lae'zel
284.text: The infamous Underdark. Don't worry of the dangers you can see - worry of the dangers you can't.
